result.execSummary:
The defendant Joseph D Rietbrock was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant IS Eligible for Challenge Incarceration and Substance Abuse Programs.

miscConds.notes: Costs to be paid as a condition of probation.

Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment, counseling.  No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription. Inform agent of all prescriptions.

Disclose to any physician in writing this case and conditions. Follow through with any treatment or counseling recommended by agent. 
  Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

timeConds.notes: Non-working hours. Release for standard conditions. To Report 08/01/16 at 6pm. LAST 75 Days are STAYED

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Joseph D Rietbrock in court with attorney Thomas G. Halloran.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State makes recommendations.  Attorney Halloran makes statements.  Defendant makes statements.  
The Court Orders the Following:  Count #1.  
Imposed and Stayed Sentence of:
30 months Imprisonment (Credit - 0 days )
30 months of Initial Confinement
30 months of Extended Supervision
Term of Probation: 2 Years
Conditions of Probation:
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
Absolute Sobriety; Random U.A.s;
No Use or Possession of illegal controlled substances or drug paraphernalia;
Inform agent of all prescriptions;
Disclose to any physician in writing this case and conditions
Condition Time: 90 days Huber (last 75 days stayed) with  NON WORKING HOURS WITH STANDARD RELEASE CONDITIONS - To commence 08/01/2016 @ 6:00 pm
COSTS:  $268.00 to be paid as a condition of probation
DNA Surcharge: $250.00 to be paid as a condition of probation
DNA Sample ordered and to be provided immediately if in custody or within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department. 
Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program
Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program
Court received information from Wisconsin Community Services regarding defendant's compliance/non-compliance.
Received July 21, 2016, from Aty Halloran, with copies of letters from Norther Crossing Behavioral Health Services and WCS
Sentencing hearing on July 22, 2016 at 11:00 am.
